Configure the information that displays by default on the list of all tracked model artifacts for each finding type.

::: {.attn}

## Prerequisites

- [x] {{< var link.login >}}
- [x] There are models registered in the model inventory.[^1]
- [x] There are artifacts logged on any model.[^2]

:::

## Customize finding type layouts

:::{.callout}
Changes are automatically saved to your account and do not affect other users.
:::

Customize what is displayed on your list of all model artifacts for each finding type:

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa triangle-exclamation >}} Findings** for the list of all model artifacts.

2. Select a finding type[^3] to view from the tabs:

   - Validation Issue
   - Policy Exception
   - Model Limitation

3. Click **{{< fa table >}} Manage Columns**.

   - Search for a column name in the list to narrow down results.
   - Toggle visibility for each item and drag each option to change the order.
   - Available columns are determined by your model finding fields.[^4]

Once customized, you can save a view for later application.[^5]

### Manage custom artifacts views

:::{.callout}
Saved views are unique to you and do not display for other users in your organization.
:::

::: {.panel-tabset}

#### Save artifacts views

You can save custom artifacts configuration as a view to reapply at any time for each finding type:

1. Customize a artifacts layout.[^6]

   You can also apply filters or sorting before saving your view to include them in the view.[^7]

{{< include /guide/model-inventory/_save-layout-view.qmd >}}

#### Edit or remove saved artifacts views

::: {.callout-important}
Deletion of saved views is permanent.
:::

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa triangle-exclamation >}} Findings** for the list of all model artifacts.

{{< include /guide/model-inventory/_remove-layout-view.qmd >}}

:::
